qas.question: How many Muslims are in Greater London?
What type of outlook do some of the Muslims in London have?
When did the Channel 4 documentary Undercover Mosque air?
The perceived British policy of being hands off of its Muslim population has resulted in what derogatory term for London?
What was Abu Hamaz al-Masri charged with when he was arrested?
How many non-Muslims are in Greater London?
What type of outlook do some of the non-Muslims in London have?
When did the Channel 8 documentary Undercover Mosque air?
The perceived British policy of being hands off of its Muslim population has resulted in what derogatory term for France?
What was Abu Hamaz al-Masri charged with when he was freed?

context: Greater London has <a0_0><a0_2>over <a0_1><b5_0>900,000<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> Muslims, (most of South Asian origins and concentrated in the East London boroughs of Newham, Tower Hamlets and Waltham Forest), and among them are some with <a1_1>a <a1_0><b6_0>strong <a1_2>Islamist<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_0/> outlook<a1_1/>. Their presence, combined with a perceived British policy of allowing them free rein, heightened by exposés such as the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>2007<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> Channel 4 documentary programme Undercover Mosque, has given rise to the term <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>Londonistan<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. Following the 9/11 attacks, however, Abu Hamza al-Masri, the imam of the Finsbury Park Mosque, was arrested and charged with <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>incitement to terrorism<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> which has caused many Islamists to leave the UK to avoid internment.[citation needed]
